DeregistrationReasonOtherText: This facility is no longer operating, the storage tank was moved to Cresbard, SD

_exec_summary.SummaryText: The following executive summary was prepared in accordance with 68.155 by the owner/operator of the South Dakota Wheat Growers Association - Conde, SD.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association, management and employees of the Conde, SD facility have implemented a variety of standard operating procedures, safe work practices, training programs and maintenance procedures designed to protect people, property, and the environment.  The facility complies with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111 Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  In the event of an emergency accidental release, it is the policy of the management of the Conde, SD facility to notify the City of Conde Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency situation.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Conde, SD facility stores and handles a variety of products and commodities associated with the production of crops.  Anhydrous ammonia is a product regulated by Part 68 of the CAA and are in use at this facility at regulated quantities.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Conde, SD facility's anhydrous accidental release prevention program complies with the Environmental Protection Agency accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with Occupational Safety and Health Adminsitrations (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111 Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia,  American Society of Testing Materials (ASTM), American National Standards Institute (ANSI), and American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) standards and regulations.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Conde, SD facility has never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.   The South Dak

ota Wheat Growers Association Conde, SD facility emergency response program complies with OSHA 1910.138.  In the event of an emergency involving the anhydrous ammonia systems, it is our policy to notify Conde Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.   The management of this facility has discussed this policy with the fire department and members of our anhydrous ammonia storage and transport systems.  In addition, it is our policy to contact the Spink County Emergency Manager.  The management and employees of the South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Conde, SD facility periodically review procedures, policies, equipment and design, and safety program elements to evaluate improvements.
